definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: Sally's party piece is singing whilst standing on her hands.
sentences.chinese: 薩利的派對絕活兒是倒立唱歌。

sentences.english: I don't know how long I'll have to play and practice before I can gain that kind of skills.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的絕活不知道要練多久才能到家和隨心應手？

sentences.english: They are adept at many special skills.
sentences.chinese: 他們有很多拿手的絕活兒。

sentences.english: The engineer called to his dog, "Do your stuff".
sentences.chinese: 工程師把他的狗喊過來，“展示你的絕活。”

sentences.english: Lili has a beautiful garden, because she has a green thumb.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉有一個漂亮的花園，因爲她有一手的絕活。

sentences.english: Players shine to live absolutely severally in succession.
sentences.chinese: 選手們紛紛亮出各自絕活兒。

sentences.english: And first,I'd like to impart my forte skill to you!
sentences.chinese: 首先，我想傳授你們我的一項拿手絕活。

sentences.english: This is the highest realm of zero risk.
sentences.chinese: 這就是零風險最高境界的絕活。

sentences.english: Both are blessed with uncommon ability to fix things.
sentences.chinese: 兩人在修理東西上都有一手絕活。

sentences.english: They said that he learned from Wang Hualan to have these "unique skills"and surpassed Wang Hualan.
sentences.chinese: 說他這些“絕活”學自王化蘭，勝過了王化蘭。

definition: to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
